introduction: Welcome to Tipsrundan #23! Time sure flies, it's around 1 year since Tipsrundan started and how much fun has been in-between (- covid). For today we got some great tips for terminal, Scala and much more!

regional.title: Competence Evenings
regional.description: Throughout the previous week we killed zombies using a coded bot (#competence_algorithms_problem_solving) and discussed how to actually write good, clean code (#bokcirkel). If you're interested to broaden your knowledge and learn more make sure to join in or ask around in #bu_competence on Slack!

videosAndPodcasts.title: Val vs Def functions in Scala
videosAndPodcasts.description: Fredrik Strandin shared a great video if you like to dig into Scala! So... what is the difference between a val (lambda/anonymous=Anonymous) and a def (method)?

random.title: pbcopy - your friend
random.description: Hannes Sandberg shared the tool 'pbcopy' which helps you copy data in the terminal into the clipboard. Example: `curl wttr.in/Malm√∂ | pbcopy`. Really simple to use and very helpful!

random.title: Small tech - Small companies that does their thing and keeps being awesome [short]
random.description: A inspiring read, I love to hear about deeply focused people/teams/companies that do their one thing really well! Excerpt: '...I made a list of small companies that I admire. Neither giants nor startups - just people making a living writing software on their own terms.'
